conversations.value:
Full Job Description

A BIT ABOUT YOU:

You're passionate and extremely motivated. You've got an ambitious spirit at heart. You're resourceful, innovative, forward-thinking, and committed. And of course (because we're Atmosfy after all!) you absolutely love travel, discovering new restaurants, nightlife, and experiences. If this sounds like you then read on friend!

As a Data Analyst at Atmosfy, you are responsible for conducting analysis to support the Product Team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing insights for the product roadmap, leading research and KPI strategies, to generate tangible insights in support of the execution of the roadmap. You are a fierce ambitious thinker with a passion for inspiring quality, innovation, and continuous improvement. This is a 100% remote, flexible role.
Compensation:

$60,000 - $90,000 yearly
Responsibilities:

WHAT YOU'LL LEAD:

 You will be responsible for owning end-to-end dashboard development including requirement gathering.
 Monitor & maintain existing dashboards in production
 Identify opportunities and influence partners to act: Provide insights to the leadership team on the impact of strategic initiatives on the key metrics
 Drive self-serve and data literacy: democratize data by building and socializing decision tools (dashboards, reports); build key data sets/pipelines to empower operational and exploratory analysis
 Define, implement and standardize metrics, reports, and dashboards

Qualifications:

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR?

 Bachelor's degree in MIS, Business, Finance, or a related field, or equivalent experience
 1+ years of working experience in data, analytics, or other relevant roles
 Must be highly proficient in SQL and Excel
 Amplitude experience is preferred
 Experience in requirement gathering & process documentation
 Ability to work cross-functionally in a fast-paced & rapidly changing environment
 Ability to tell stories with data, educate effectively, and instill confidence, motivating stakeholders to act on recommendations
 Ability to influence business decisions and utilize data at the leadership level

PERKS & BENEFITS

 Completely remote, flexible work schedule
 Unlimited Vacation, Paid Sick Days & Holidays
 Employee Covered Medical, Dental, Vision Plan Base Plan
 Dining/Nightlife Stipend
 Company Events

About Company
We are Atmosfy.
And we're the fastest growing platform globally for live video of dining and nightlife - that shows you what's happening in your city in real-time. More than that though - we help support local businesses globally by sharing unique experiences through video. How cool is that? We help people in more than 150 countries and 10,000+ cities discover the world's best experiences.
Our team draws on talented people who have worked at best-in-class companies such as Facebook, Google, and Netflix. We are funded by world-class investors.
Check us out on the App Store or Google Play to learn more about our mission to share experiences, inspire others, and support local businesses around the world.

what are possible problems for the job listed above

Some possible problems for the Data Analyst position at Atmosfy could be:

1. Remote work challenges: As the job is 100% remote, there could be difficulties in effectively communicating with the team, maintaining work-life balance, and ensuring productivity.
2. Technical skills gap: The requirement of high proficiency in SQL and Excel may lead to difficulties in finding the right candidate with the necessary technical skills.
3. Time management: Balancing the tasks of end-to-end dashboard development, monitoring, and maintaining existing dashboards, conducting research, and generating insights can be challenging.
4. Data analysis: The Data Analyst will need to have the ability to identify opportunities, provide insights to the leadership team, and effectively tell stories with data, which requires advanced data analysis and interpretation skills.
5. Collaboration: As the job requires the ability to work cross-functionally in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment, there may be challenges in collaborating effectively with various teams and stakeholders.
6. Stakeholder management: The Data Analyst will need to influence business decisions and educate stakeholders on data-driven recommendations, which requires strong stakeholder management skills.

here is more information about the company. Atmosfy is the fastest growing platform globally for live video of dining and nightlife. More than that though - we help support local businesses globally by sharing unique experiences. How cool is that? We help people in more than 150 countries and 10,000 cities discover the world's best experiences through video. But inspiring a global audience through mouth watering videos of maple syrup dripping off chicken and waffles or FOMO inducing nightclubs is hard work. That's why we employ the most creative, passionate people in the industry.

We believe that through inspiration we can lead richer lives, while supporting local businesses that need it the most. We are a team that values revolutionary thinking and a bias for action. Come join us and revolutionize how people discover experiences. Our team draws on talented people who have worked at best-in-class companies such as Instagram, Google, and Netflix. We are funded by world-class investors.

Check us out on the App Store or Google Play to learn more about our mission to share experiences, inspire others, and support local businesses around the world.

Generate possible problems from the previous job listing using this info

Some possible problems based on the additional information about Atmosfy are:

1. Scalability challenges: As Atmosfy is the fastest growing platform globally, there could be difficulties in scaling the platform to meet the increasing demand while maintaining the high-quality user experience.
2. Competition: With a focus on dining and nightlife experiences, Atmosfy may face competition from other similar platforms, and it may be challenging to differentiate and remain competitive.
3. Data privacy: With live video streaming, there may be concerns around data privacy and security, which could lead to potential regulatory issues.
4. Localization: With operations in more than 150 countries and 10,000 cities, Atmosfy may face challenges in localizing the platform to meet the unique cultural and regional requirements of each market.
5. Integration with local businesses: Atmosfy's mission is to support local businesses, and there may be challenges in establishing and maintaining strong partnerships with these businesses to ensure their success.
6. Creative and talented team: As Atmosfy draws on talented people from companies such as Instagram, Google, and Netflix, there may be difficulties in attracting and retaining the best talent in a highly competitive industry.

how could i use sql for Scalability challenges: As Atmosfy is the fastest growing platform globally, there could be difficulties in scaling the platform to meet the increasing demand while maintaining the high-quality user experience.

SQL can be used to address scalability challenges in the following ways:

1. Optimizing database design: SQL can be used to improve database design to handle a large volume of data, such as implementing indexing, normalizing tables, and creating denormalized tables for faster data retrieval.
2. Query optimization: SQL can be used to optimize database queries to reduce the time it takes to retrieve data. This includes optimizing joins, indexes, and reducing the complexity of queries.
3. Partitioning: SQL can be used to partition the database into smaller units, which can be stored and managed on separate servers, helping to improve performance and scalability.
4. Data warehousing: SQL can be used to create a data warehousing solution, where large amounts of data can be stored and analyzed to support business intelligence and data analytics.
5. Cloud-based solutions: SQL can be used to store data in cloud-based solutions, such as Amazon Web Services or Google Cloud Platform, which provide scalable infrastructure to handle increasing demand.

By using SQL in these ways, Atmosfy can address scalability challenges, ensure high-quality user experience, and support the platform's growth.
how would i use Amazon web services for a cloud based solution. explain in simple terms.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a cloud computing platform that provides a range of services that can be used to build and run cloud-based solutions. To use AWS for a cloud-based solution, you would start by selecting the specific services that you need to build and run your application or solution. Some of the most commonly used services include:

1. Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2): This is a cloud-based computing service that provides scalable computing capacity in the cloud.
2. Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3): This is a highly durable and scalable cloud-based storage solution that can be used to store and access data from anywhere in the world.
3. Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS): This is a managed relational database service that makes it easy to set up, operate, and scale a relational database in the cloud.
4. Amazon Elastic Load Balancer (ELB): This service automatically distributes incoming application traffic across multiple Amazon EC2 instances.

You would use these services and others to build, deploy, and run your solution in the cloud. You would then be able to easily scale your solution as demand increases, without having to worry about managing and maintaining the underlying infrastructure.
what could i use specifically in AWS to develop a cloud based solution for scalability challenges

To address scalability challenges in a cloud-based solution, one could utilize several services in Amazon Web Services (AWS) such as:

1. Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2): provides scalable computing capacity in the cloud, allowing you to quickly scale your application as demand grows.
2. Amazon Auto Scaling: automatically adjusts the number of EC2 instances to handle changes in demand.
3. Amazon Simple Queue Service (SQS): provides a managed message queue service that enables decoupling of the components of a cloud application.
4. Amazon ElastiCache: provides in-memory caching that can be used to offload read-intensive database workloads, which can improve the performance and scalability of your application.
5. Amazon DynamoDB: a fast, fully managed NoSQL database that can automatically scale and handle large amounts of data and traffic.
6. Amazon S3: provides scalable and durable object storage, which can be used to store large amounts of data, media, and backups.

These AWS services can be used together to build a scalable and highly available cloud-based solution that can handle increasing demand while maintaining high performance.
